artworkTitle: Prehistoric Art depicted in Conceptual Art Style

keySubjects: Cave walls or rocky landscape elements (as subject matter)
conceptDefinition.narrativeFocus: Depict a group of simplified, active human figures engaged in hunting a large bison or similar prehistoric animal. Focus on the action and relationship between hunters and prey.
conceptDefinition.desiredEmotion: A mix of ritualistic reverence, primal tension, and the importance of the hunt for survival.
symbolismHints: Emphasize the size and power of the animal
Use repetitive patterns if suggesting ritual
references: Altamira cave art depictions of bison

styleDefinition.origin: Conceptual Art (International, c. mid-1960s - mid-1970s AD, ongoing influence)
visualCharacteristics: Primacy of the idea or concept over traditional aesthetic and material concerns
Visual form is secondary and determined by the concept; often appears dematerialized or minimal
Can manifest as text (instructions, definitions, statements), photography (documentation), maps, diagrams, found objects, performance documentation, or installations
Rejection of traditional notions of skill, beauty, and the art object itself
Often analytical, informational, or seemingly mundane in appearance
Focus on intellectual process, systems, language, and information
techniques: Simulation of text-based art (typed/printed statements, definitions)
Simulation of documentary photography (often black and white, straightforward)
Simulation of diagrams, charts, or maps
Use of language and systems as the primary medium
Execution often follows predefined instructions or systems
styleDefinition.mediumSimulation: Documentation style simulation (e.g., typed text on paper, black and white photograph, map, diagram)

colorPalette.description: Generally neutral, functional, or dictated by the chosen medium (e.g., black text on white paper, monochrome photography). Color is typically not used for expressive or traditional aesthetic purposes, prioritizing informational clarity or conceptual austerity.
keyColors: (Colors inherent to documentary sources like maps or diagrams)

styleDefinition.textureEmphasis: Typically minimal or functional textures associated with the medium (smoothness of paper, photographic print). Avoids expressive or aesthetically emphasized textures; focus is on the information or concept.
styleDefinition.compositionStyle: Composition is entirely dictated by the underlying concept or the format of the information being presented (e.g., list, grid, instructions, map layout, documentary photograph framing). Rejects traditional aesthetic compositional principles in favor of conceptual clarity or systematic presentation.
references: Sol LeWitt (Wall drawings, 'Paragraphs on Conceptual Art')

sceneContext.lightingStyle: Flat, even, bright lighting with no discernible source or shadows, typical of Egyptian art.
sceneContext.cameraView: Strict profile or composite view, straight-on perspective, avoiding complex angles.
sceneContext.settingSuggestion: A stylized representation of a cave interior or outdoor landscape, framed perhaps with simple geometric Egyptian borders or patterns.

avoid: Dynamic, fluid poses (use stiff Egyptian poses)
